page.title: 04ROADS IN THE DON VALLEY
page.content: A lot of heavy vehicles such as lorries and transporters travel down the main{roads}of Attercliffe and Darnall and the surrounding areas. This is because of the steel and engineering works and the many small new industries in the area.There is a wholesale{market}in Darnall and many lorries and vans go there to collect fruit and vegetables for distribution over a wide area. Regular{bus}services carry people to and from work.They are most busy from 8 a.m. to 9 a.m. and again from 5 p.m. to 6 p.m.at teatime. South Yorkshire Passenger Transport bus services are subsidised by the rates and are very cheap to use. A bus trip for a child costs only 2p. regardless of the distance travelled. The adult fare for the three mile journey to the town only costs 10p.
